meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I constringed the rope to make it shorter.
meanings.sent2: She constringed her hair into a neat bun for the party.
meanings.sent3: The magician constringed the scarf into a tiny ball, amazing the audience.
meanings.sent4: His heart constringed with fear as he approached the dark forest.
meanings.sent5: The cold water constringed my skin, sending shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: constringed: made or become narrow or contracted
meanings.sent1: The constringed path led us through the dense forest.
meanings.sent2: Her constringed waistline showed the result of her hard work at the gym.
meanings.sent3: The constringed opening barely allowed the cat to squeeze through.
meanings.sent4: The constringed alley felt suffocating in the midday heat.
meanings.sent5: The constringed rope held the weight securely, not budging an inch.

meanings.sent1: The constringed rules left no room for interpretation.
meanings.sent2: His constringed budget forced him to cut back on unnecessary expenses.
meanings.sent3: The constringed time frame made it challenging to complete the project.
meanings.sent4: The constringed grip of fear paralyzed him in place.
meanings.sent5: The constringed collar felt uncomfortable around his neck, making him fidget.
